intro: Dichapetalum rufum, commonly known as the red-veined or red-flowered dichapetalum, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking red veins on its leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside its native range.
